text: He is here and she is here.
translate: On je tukaj in ona je tukaj / tu.
Mi smo tukaj. / Me smo tukaj.
Vi ste tukaj / tu. / Ve ste tukaj / tu.
Oni vsi so tukaj. / One vse so tukaj.

text: I was at the cinema yesterday.
translate: Včeraj sem bil / bila v kinu.

text: Do you drink tea with lemon?
Do you drink coffee with sugar?
Do you drink water with ice?
People are drinking wine and beer.
Do you drink Coke with rum?
The child likes cocoa and apple juice.
translate: Otroci imajo radi kakav in jabolčni sok.

text: The woman likes orange and grapefruit juice.
translate: Ženske imajo rade pomarančni sok in sok grenivke.

text: We only work for five days.

translate: Mi lahko poveste, koliko je ura?

text: Where do they like to go?
translate: Kam radi (rade) gredo? / Kam rada (radi) gresta?

text: They like to listen to music.
translate: Radi (Rade) poslušajo glasbo. / Rada (Radi) poslušata glasbo.

text: Where do they not like to go?
translate: Kam neradi (nerade) hodijo? / Kam nerada (neradi) hodita?

text: They do not like to dance.
We like to go for a walk in summer.
It snows or rains in winter.
We like to stay home in winter.
What is the weather like today?
In which hotel are you staying?
How long have you been here for?
How long will you be staying?
Shall we see each other tomorrow?
I am sorry, but I already have plans.
translate: Žal mi je, za jutri imam že nekaj drugega v načrtu.

text: I have a kiwi and a melon.
translate: Imam en kivi in eno melono.

text: I have an orange and a grapefruit.
translate: Imam eno pomarančo in eno grenivko.

text: I have an apple and a mango.
translate: Imam eno jabolko in en mango.

text: I have a banana and a pineapple.
translate: Imam eno banano in en ananas.

text: I am making a fruit salad.
I am eating toast with butter.
I am eating toast with butter and jam.
translate: Jem toast z maslom in marmelado.

text: I am eating a sandwich with margarine.
I am eating a sandwich with margarine and tomatoes.
translate: Jem sendvič z margarino in paradižnikom.

text: We need carrots and tomatoes for the soup.
translate: Potrebujemo (potrebujeva) korenje in paradižnik za juho.

text: What would you like to drink?
Do you play a musical instrument?
I am currently reading this book.
What do you like to read?
Do you like to go to concerts?
Do you like to go to the theatre / theater (am.)?
Do you like to go to the opera?
There is a garden behind the house.
There is no street in front of the house.
There are trees next to the house.
The kitchen and bathroom are here.
The living room and bedroom are there.
translate: Tam sta dnevna soba in spalnica.

text: We are going to the living room.
There is a sofa and an armchair there.
The TV set is brand new.

translate: Ali vam smem predstaviti gospoda Müllerja?

text: Are you here for the first time?
No, I was here once last year.
translate: Ne, bil sem tukaj že lani.

text: How do you like it here?
translate: Kako vam je všeč pri nas?

text: A lot. The people are nice.
And I like the scenery, too.
translate: In pokrajina mi je tudi všeč.
London se nahaja v Veliki Britaniji.

text: Peter and Martha are from Berlin.
translate: Peter in Marta sta iz Berlina.

text: No, my wife / my husband is also here.
translate: Ne, z mano je tudi žena / mož.

text: And those are my two children.
translate: In tam sta oba moja otroka.

text: Do both of you speak German?
Madrid and Berlin are also capital cities.
translate: Madrid in Berlin sta tudi glavna mesta.

text: Capital cities are big and noisy.
translate: Glavna mesta so velika in bučna.
Kanada se nahaja v Severni Ameriki.
Panama se nahaja v Srednji Ameriki.
Brazilija se nahaja v Južni Ameriki.

text: We are having class / a lesson.
We want to speak with people.
Yes, and I also speak some Italian.
translate: Da, in malo znam tudi italijansko.

text: I think you speak very well.
translate: Zdi se mi, da govorite zelo dobro.

text: But speaking and writing is difficult.
translate: Vendar pa je govoriti in pisati težko.

text: You only have a slight accent.
One can tell where you come from.
What is your mother tongue / native language (am.)?
Are you taking a language course?
translate: Ali hodite na kakšen jezikovni tečaj?

text: I don’t remember the name right now.
translate: V tem trenutku ne vem, kako se temu reče.

text: The title is not coming to me.
What colour / color (am.) is the snow? White.
What colour / color (am.) is the sun? Yellow.
What colour / color (am.) is the orange? Orange.
What colour / color (am.) is the cherry? Red.
What colour / color (am.) is the sky? Blue.
What colour / color (am.) is the grass? Green.
What colour / color (am.) is the earth? Brown.
What colour / color (am.) is the cloud? Grey / Gray (am.).
What colour / color (am.) are the tyres / tires (am.)? Black.
translate: Kakšno barvo imajo avtomobilske gume? Črno.

text: I waited for you for half an hour.
Don’t you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
Take an umbrella with you next time!
I have the day off tomorrow.
I’m sorry, I can’t make it tomorrow.
translate: Žal mi je, ampak jutri ne morem.

text: Do you already have plans for this weekend?
translate: Ali imaš za ta vikend že kakšno obveznost?

text: Or do you already have an appointment?
translate: Ali pa že imaš dogovorjen drug zmenek?

text: I suggest that we meet on the weekend.
translate: Predlagam, da se dobimo (dobiva) ta vikend.

text: Shall we go to the beach?
Shall we go to the mountains?
I will pick you up at the office.
I will pick you up at home.
I will pick you up at the bus stop.
translate: Prišel bom pote na avtobusno postajo.

text: Do you have a new kitchen?
What do you want to cook today?
Do you cook on an electric or a gas stove?
translate: Kuhaš na elektriko ali na plin?

text: Do you have a tin opener / can opener (am.)?
Do you have a bottle opener?
Are you cooking the soup in this pot?
Are you frying the fish in this pan?
Are you grilling the vegetables on this grill?
Here are the knives, the forks and the spoons.
translate: Tukaj so noži, vilice in žlice.

text: Here are the glasses, the plates and the napkins.
translate: Tukaj so kozarci, krožniki in prtički.

text: I would like to go to the station.
translate: Rad bi šel / Rada bi šla na železniško postajo.

text: I would like to go to the airport.
translate: Rad bi šel / Rada bi šla na letališče.

text: I would like to go to the city centre / center (am.).
translate: Rad bi šel / Rada bi šla v center mesta.

text: How do I get to the station?
How do I get to the airport?
How do I get to the city centre / center (am.)?
I would like to rent a car.
What is there to see in the city?
translate: Kaj se da videti v mestu?
Pojdite na krožno vožnjo po mestu.

text: Go on a harbour / harbor (am.) tour.
translate: Pojdite na krožno vožnjo po pristanišču.

text: Are there any other places of interest?
Does it disturb you if I smoke?

translate: Da, večinoma so to poslovna potovanja.

text: Do you have a vacant room?
What does the room cost per night?
translate: Koliko stane ena nočitev v tej sobi?

text: I would like a room with a bathroom.
I would like a room with a shower.
Is there a fax machine here?
What time do you serve breakfast?
What time do you serve lunch?
What time do you serve dinner?
Do you see the tower there?
Do you see the mountain there?
Do you see the village there?
Do you see the river there?
Do you see the bridge there?
Do you see the lake there?

translate: Tisti ptič tam mi je všeč.
Ta kamen tukaj mi je všeč.
Te rože tukaj so mi všeč.

text: I would like the menu, please.
I’d like a coffee with milk.
I’d like a tea with lemon.
I’d like chips / French fries (am.) with ketchup.
I’d like a tea with milk.
Do you also like to eat leek?
Do you also like to eat sauerkraut?
translate: Ali radi jeste tudi kislo zelje?

text: Do you also like to eat lentils?
Do you also like to eat carrots?
Do you also like to eat broccoli?
Do you also like to eat peppers?
Is that the train to Berlin?
When does the train arrive in Berlin?
I think this is my seat.
translate: Mislim, da je to moje mesto.

text: I think you’re sitting in my seat.
translate: Mislim, da sedite na mojem mestu.

text: The sleeper is at the end of the train.
And where is the dining car? – At the front.
translate: Kje pa je jedilni voz? – Na začetku.

text: Can I sleep in the middle?
Can I sleep at the top?
When will we get to the border?
How long does the journey to Berlin take?
translate: Kako dolgo traja vožnja do Berlina?

text: Do you have something to read?
Can one get something to eat and to drink here?
translate: Se lahko tukaj dobi kaj za jesti in piti?

text: Could you please wake me up at 7 o’clock?
translate: Me boste, prosim, zbudili ob sedmih?

text: I would like an ice cream with whipped cream.
I would like some fruit or cheese.
We would like to have breakfast.
We would like to have lunch.
We would like to have dinner.
What would you like for breakfast?
Some salt and pepper also, please.
I’d like a glass of red wine.
I’d like a glass of white wine.
I’d like a bottle of champagne.
I’d like something that won’t take much time.
translate: Rad(a) bi nekaj, na kar ne bo treba dolgo čakati.

text: Would you like that with rice?
Would you like that with pasta?
Would you like that with potatoes?

translate: To mi ne tekne. (To mi ni okusno.)

text: Which bus goes to the city centre / center (am.)?
Which bus do I have to take?
translate: S katerim avtobusom se moram peljati?

text: Where do I have to change?
How much does a ticket cost?
How many stops are there before downtown / the city centre?
translate: Koliko postaj je odtod do centra?

text: You have to get off here.
You have to get off at the back.
The next train is in 5 minutes.
translate: Naslednji vlak (podzemske železnice) prispe čez 5 minut.

text: The next tram is in 10 minutes.
The next bus is in 15 minutes.
A ticket? – No, I don’t have one.
Then you have to pay a fine.
translate: V tem primeru morate plačati kazen.

text: I’d like to book a flight to Athens.
translate: Rad(a) bi rezerviral(a) let v Atene.
Prosim sedež pri oknu, v oddelku za nekadilce.

text: I would like to confirm my reservation.
I would like to cancel my reservation.
I would like to change my reservation.
When is the next flight to Rome?
translate: Kdaj odleti naslednje letalo v Rim?

text: No, we have only one seat available.
translate: Ne, imamo le še eno prosto mesto.

text: When does a bus go to the city centre / center (am.)?
translate: Kdaj pelje kakšen avtobus v center mesta?

text: How much luggage can I take?
translate: Koliko prtljage lahko vzamem s sabo?

text: When is the next train to Berlin?
translate: Kdaj gre naslednji vlak v Berlin?

text: When is the next train to Paris?
translate: Kdaj gre naslednji vlak v Pariz?

text: When is the next train to London?
translate: Kdaj gre naslednji vlak v London?

text: When does the train for Warsaw leave?
translate: Ob kateri uri gre vlak v Varšavo?

text: When does the train for Stockholm leave?
translate: Ob kateri uri gre vlak v Stockholm?

text: When does the train for Budapest leave?
translate: Ob kateri uri gre vlak v Budimpešto?

text: I’d like a ticket to Madrid.
I’d like a ticket to Prague.
I’d like a ticket to Bern.
When does the train arrive in Vienna?
When does the train arrive in Moscow?
When does the train arrive in Amsterdam?
Do I have to change trains?
From which platform does the train leave?

translate: Ali je v tem vlaku spalnik?

text: I’d like a one-way ticket to Brussels.
translate: Rad bi samo enosmerno vozovnico do Bruselja.

text: I’d like a return ticket to Copenhagen.
translate: Rad bi povratno vozovnico do Kopenhagena.

text: What does a berth in the sleeper cost?
translate: Koliko stane eno mesto v spalniku?

text: What does it cost to go to the station?
translate: Koliko stane prevoz do železniške postaje?

text: What does it cost to go to the airport?
Please turn left at the corner.
translate: Prosim tam na vogalu na levo.
Dajte mi, prosim, potrdilo o plačilu.

text: That is okay, please keep the change.
translate: V redu, ostanek je za vas.

text: Is the market open on Sundays?
Is the fair open on Mondays?
Is the exhibition open on Tuesdays?
Is the zoo open on Wednesdays?
translate: Je živalski vrt ob sredah odprt?

text: Is the museum open on Thursdays?
Is the gallery open on Fridays?
Does one have to pay an entrance fee?
How much is the entrance fee?
Is there a discount for groups?
Is there a discount for children?
Is there a discount for students?

translate: Zanima me arhitektura. (Zanimam se za arhitekturo.)
Zanima me umetnost. (Zanimam se za umetnost.)
Zanima me slikarstvo. (Zanimam se za slikarstvo.)

text: Is there a good restaurant around here?
translate: Kje je tukaj kakšna dobra restavracija?

text: Take a left at the corner.
translate: Tam na vogalu pojdite na levo.

text: Then go straight for a while.
Then go right for a hundred metres / meters (am.).
translate: Potem pojdite sto metrov na desno.

text: You can also take the bus.
You can also take the tram.
You can also follow me with your car.
translate: Lahko se tudi enostavno peljete za mano.

text: How do I get to the football / soccer (am.) stadium?
Drive until you reach the third traffic light.
Then turn into the first street on your right.
translate: Potem zavijte v prvo ulico na desni.

text: Then drive straight through the next intersection.
translate: Zatem peljite naravnost čez naslednje križišče.

text: Excuse me, how do I get to the airport?
It is best if you take the underground / subway (am.).
translate: Najbolje je, da greste s podzemsko železnico (z metrojem).

text: Simply get out at the last stop.
translate: Peljite se enostavno do končne postaje.

text: What’s playing at the theatre / theater (am.) this evening?
translate: Kaj danes zvečer (nocoj) predvajajo v gledališču?

text: What’s playing at the cinema / movies (am.) this evening?
translate: Kaj je danes zvečer (nocoj) na sporedu v kinu?
Kaj je danes zvečer (nocoj) na televiziji?

text: Are tickets for the theatre / theater (am.) still available?
translate: Ali se še dobi vstopnice za gledališče?

text: Are tickets for the cinema / movies (am.) still available?
translate: Ali se še dobi vstopnice za kino?

text: Are tickets for the football / soccer am. game still available?
translate: Ali se še dobi vstopnice za nogometno tekmo?

text: I want to sit in the back.
I want to sit somewhere in the middle.
translate: Rad(a) bi sedel(a) nekje v sredini.

text: I want to sit at the front.
Can you get me a ticket?
Is there a golf course nearby?
translate: Je tu v bližini kakšno igrišče za golf?

text: Is there a tennis court nearby?
translate: Je tu v bližini kakšno teniško igrišče?

text: Is there an indoor swimming pool nearby?
translate: Je tu v bližini kakšen pokriti bazen?

text: Where is the tourist information office?
Do you have a city map for me?
translate: Ali imate zame kakšen zemljevid mesta?

text: Can one reserve a room here?
translate: Ali je možno tukaj rezervirati hotelsko sobo?
Kdaj se začne ogled mesta z vodnikom?
Kdaj se konča ogled mesta z vodnikom?
Kako dolgo traja ogled mesta z vodnikom?

text: I would like a guide who speaks German.
I would like a guide who speaks Italian.
I would like a guide who speaks French.
We want to go to the cinema.
A good film is playing today.
translate: Danes je na sporedu en dober film.

text: How much are the admission tickets?
I want to sit at the back.
I want to sit at the front.
I want to sit in the middle.
But the book on which the film was based was better.
translate: Vendar je bila knjiga, po kateri je bil posnet film, boljša.

text: I also have a video camera.
Where can I find a battery?
There is a café over there.
There is a restaurant over there.
Where are the gorillas and the zebras?
Where are the tigers and the crocodiles?

translate: On se pelje z motornim kolesom (z motorjem).

text: Is it dangerous to hitchhike alone?
translate: Ali je tukaj nevarno, če sam potuješ z avtoštopom?

text: Is it dangerous to go for a walk at night?
translate: Ali se je nevarno sprehajati ponoči?

text: Is there a parking lot here?
How long can one park here?
translate: Kako dolgo se sme tukaj parkirati?

text: Do you take the ski lift to the top?
translate: Se boste peljali gor s smučarsko žičnico (sedežnico, vlečnico)?
Si je možno tukaj izposoditi smuči?

text: Where is the next gas station?
I have a flat tyre / tire (am.).
Can you change the tyre / tire (am.)?
I need a few litres / liters (am.) of diesel.
I have no more petrol / gas (am.).
Do you have a petrol can / jerry can / gas can (am.)?
translate: Ali imate posodo za rezervno gorivo?

text: Where can I make a call?
Do you have a mobile / cell phone (am.) with you?
You have to pack our suitcase!
Don’t forget your traveller’s cheques / traveler’s checks (am.)!
Take some suntan lotion with you.
translate: Vzemi s sabo kremo za sončenje.

text: Take the sun hat with you.
Do you want to take a road map?
translate: Hočeš s seboj vzeti avtomobilsko karto?

text: Do you want to take a travel guide?
translate: Hočeš s seboj vzeti turistični vodnik?

text: Do you want to take an umbrella?
Remember to take pants, shirts and socks.
translate: Ne pozabi na hlače, srajce, nogavice.

text: Remember to take ties, belts and sports jackets.
translate: Ne pozabi na kravate, pasove, sakoje.

text: Remember to take pyjamas, nightgowns and t-shirts.
translate: Ne pozabi na pižame, spalne srajce in majice.

text: You need shoes, sandals and boots.
translate: Rabil boš čevlje, sandale in škornje.

text: You need handkerchiefs, soap and a nail clipper.
translate: Rabil boš robce, milo in škarjice za nohte.

text: You need a comb, a toothbrush and toothpaste.
translate: Rabil boš glavnik, zobno ščetko in zobno pasto.

text: Isn’t it dangerous to swim there?
Can one rent a sun umbrella / parasol here?
translate: Si je možno tukaj izposoditi sončnik?

text: Can one rent a deck chair here?
translate: Si je možno tukaj izposoditi ležalnik?

text: Can one rent a boat here?
translate: Si je možno tukaj izposoditi čoln?

text: I would like to water ski.

translate: Že kar dobro mi gre to.
Pa imaš s sabo smučarske čevlje?

text: Shall we go to the swimming pool?
Do you have a bathing suit?
Can you jump in the water?
I am getting out of the water now.
translate: Jaz grem zdaj ven iz vode.

text: How do you like the music?
But the band plays very well.
translate: Vendar igra bend čisto v redu.

text: No, this is the first time.
Shall we go to the department store?
I want to do a lot of shopping.

translate: Potrebujem pisemske ovitke in pisemski papir.

text: I need a cupboard and a chest of drawers.
I need a desk and a bookshelf.
translate: Potrebujem pisalno mizo in regal (eno polico).

text: I need a doll and a teddy bear.
I need a football and a chess board.

I need a drill and a screwdriver.

A large one or a small one?

Or is it made of plastic?

text: Can I exchange it if needed?
I want to go to the library.
I want to go to the bookstore.
I want to go to the newspaper stand.
I want to borrow a book.
translate: Rad(a) bi si izposodil(a) eno knigo.

text: I want to buy a book.
I want to buy a newspaper.
I want to go to the library to borrow a book.

text: I want to go to the bookstore to buy a book.
translate: Rad(a) bi šel(šla) v knjigarno kupit eno knjigo.

text: I want to go to the kiosk / newspaper stand to buy a newspaper.

text: I want to go to the optician.
I want to go to the supermarket.
I want to go to the bakery.
I want to buy some glasses.
I want to buy fruit and vegetables.
I want to buy rolls and bread.
I want to go to the optician to buy glasses.

text: I want to go to the supermarket to buy fruit and vegetables.
translate: Hočem v samopostrežnico po sadje in zelenjavo.

text: I want to go to the baker to buy rolls and bread.
translate: Hočem v pekarno po žemlje in kruh.

text: I am a member of a sports club.

translate: Ali pa se vozimo s kolesi.

text: There is a football / soccer (am.) stadium in our city.
translate: V našem mestu imamo nogometni stadion.

text: There is also a swimming pool with a sauna.
translate: Imamo tudi plavalni bazen s savno.

text: And there is a golf course.
There is a football / soccer (am.) match on now.
The German team is playing against the English one.
We’re looking for a sports shop.
We’re looking for a butcher shop.
We’re looking for a pharmacy / drugstore (am.).
We want to buy a football.

Radi bi namreč kupili (Rada bi kupila, Rade bi kupile) salamo.
Radi bi namreč kupili (Rada bi kupila, Rade bi kupile) zdravila.

text: We’re looking for a sports shop to buy a football.
translate: Iščemo (iščeva) trgovino s športnimi potrebščinami, da bi kupili (kupili, kupile) nogometno žogo.

text: We’re looking for a butcher shop to buy salami.
translate: Iščemo (iščeva) mesarijo, da bi kupili (kupile) salamo.

text: We’re looking for a drugstore to buy medicine.
translate: Iščemo (iščeva) lekarno, da bi kupili (kupile) zdravila.

text: I’m looking for a jeweller / jeweler (am.).
I’m looking for a photo equipment store.
I actually plan to buy a ring.
I actually plan to buy a roll of film.
I actually plan to buy a cake.
I’m looking for a jeweler to buy a ring.

text: I’m looking for a photo shop to buy a roll of film.
translate: Iščem trgovino s fotomaterialom, ker bi rad kupil film.

text: I’m looking for a confectionery to buy a cake.
translate: Iščem slaščičarno, ker bi rad kupil torto.

text: We feel like. / We want to.
translate: Mi uživamo (se imamo prijetno). / Midva (Medve) uživava (se imava prijetno).

text: We don’t feel like. / We do’t want to.

translate: Ona se ne dolgočasi. (Njej ni dolgčas.)

text: I have the appointment at ten o’clock.
Please take a seat in the waiting room.
The doctor is on his way.
What insurance company do you belong to?
What can I do for you?
Lie down on the examining table.
I will give you an injection.
I will give you some pills.
I am giving you a prescription for the pharmacy.
translate: Dal(a) vam bom recept za v lekarno.

text: What do you do for a living?

translate: Moj mož je po poklicu zdravnik.

text: I work as a nurse part-time.
translate: Jaz delam kot medicinska sestra s polovičnim delovnim časom.

text: We will soon receive our pension.
What would you like to become some day?
I would like to become an engineer.
I want to go to college.
I am doing an internship abroad.
We always go to the cafeteria at noon.
I am looking for a job.
I have already been unemployed for a year.
There are too many unemployed people in this country.
translate: V tej deželi je preveč brezposelnih.

text: The man is wearing a hat.
One cannot see the ears either.
One cannot see his back either.
I am drawing the eyes and the mouth.
The man is dancing and laughing.
The man has a long nose.
He is carrying a cane in his hands.
He is also wearing a scarf around his neck.
It is winter and it is cold.

text: He is not allowed to sleep in the car.

text: I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
translate: Ne pridem, ker je vreme tako slabo.

text: He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
I am not coming because I have no time.
translate: Ne bom prišel/prišla, ker nimam časa.

text: I am not staying because I still have to work.
translate: Ne ostanem zaradi tega, ker imam še delo.

text: I’m going because it is already late.
He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
translate: Ne jem je, ker moram shujšati.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?
I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
translate: Ne pijem ga, ker moram še voziti.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
translate: Ne pijem je, ker je mrzla.

text: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
translate: Ne pijem ga, ker nimam sladkorja.

text: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
translate: Ne jem je, ker je nisem naročil(a).

text: Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
translate: Ne jem ga, ker sem vegetarijanec (vegetarijanka).

text: I didn’t come because I was ill.
translate: Nisem prišel, ker sem bil bolan. (Nisem prišla, ker sem bila bolna.)

text: She didn’t come because she was tired.
translate: Ni prišla, ker je bila utrujena.

text: He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
translate: Ni prišel, ker mu ni bilo do tega.

text: We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
translate: Nismo prišli, ker imamo pokvarjen avto.

text: They didn’t come because they missed the train.
translate: Niso prišli, ker so zamudili vlak.

text: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
Did you have to call an ambulance?
Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
translate: Ali imate telefonsko številko? Pravkar sem jo še imel(a).

text: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
translate: Ali imate naslov? Pravkar sem ga še imel(a).

text: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
translate: Ali imate načrt mesta? Pravkar sem ga še imel(a).

text: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
translate: Je prišel točno? On ni mogel priti pravočasno.

text: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
translate: Je našel pot? Ni mogel najti poti.

text: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
translate: Te je razumel? Ni me mogel razumeti.

text: Why could you not come on time?
Why could you not find the way?
Why could you not understand him?
I could not come on time because there were no buses.
translate: Nisem mogel (mogla) priti točno, ker ni vozil noben avtobus.

text: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
translate: Nisem mogel (mogla) najti poti, ker nisem imel(a) načrta mesta.

text: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
translate: Nisem ga mogel (mogla) razumeti, ker je bila glasba tako glasna.

text: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
I had to switch off the radio.
I am wearing a blue dress.

text: I am wearing a red dress.
translate: Na sebi imam (Oblečeno imam) rdečo obleko.

text: I am wearing a green dress.
translate: Na sebi imam (Oblečeno imam) zeleno obleko.

text: An old lady lives at the top.
A fat lady lives at the top.

translate: Naši gostje so bili prijetni (prijazni, ljubeznivi) ljudje.
Naši gostje so bili vljudni ljudje.
Naši gostje so bili zanimivi ljudje.

text: But the neighbours have naughty children.
She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
translate: On je bil nezvest, ona pa zvesta.

text: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
translate: On je bil len, ona pa marljiva.

text: He was poor, but she was rich.
translate: On je bil reven, ona pa bogata.

text: He had no money, only debts.
translate: On ni imel denarja, pač pa dolgove.

text: He had no luck, only bad luck.
translate: On ni imel sreče, pač pa smolo.

text: He had no success, only failure.
translate: On ni bil uspešen, pač pa je bil neuspešen.

text: He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
translate: On ni bil zadovoljen, pač pa je bil nezadovoljen.

text: He was not happy, but sad.
translate: On ni bil srečen, pač pa je bil nesrečen.

text: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
translate: On ni bil simpatičen, pač pa je bil antipatičen.

text: How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?

text: What did you come to know?
You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
translate: Ti si tako len(a) – ne bodi vendar tako len(a)!

text: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
translate: Ti tako dolgo spiš – ne spi vendar tako dolgo!

text: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
translate: Ti prihajaš tako pozno – daj vendar, ne prihajaj tako pozno!

text: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
translate: Ti se smeješ tako glasno – ne smej se vendar tako glasno!

text: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
translate: Ti govoriš tako tiho – ne govori vendar tako tiho!

text: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
translate: Ti preveč piješ – daj vendar, ne pij toliko!

text: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
translate: Ti preveč kadiš – daj vendar, ne kadi toliko!

text: You work too much – don’t work so much!
translate: Ti preveč delaš – ne delaj toliko!

text: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
translate: Ti voziš tako hitro – ne vozi vendar tako hitro!

text: I was talking on the phone all the time.
We had to water the flowers.

We had to wash the dishes.

text: Who had to take the train?

text: We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.

text: I thought you wanted to call information.

text: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.

text: I know that – I knew that.
I write that – I wrote that.
I hear that – I heard that.
I’ll get it – I got it.

text: I’ll bring that – I brought that.
I’ll buy that – I bought that.

I know that – I knew that.

I hope that it gets better.

I think that it is old.

text: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.

text: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
translate: Jezi me to, da piješ tako veliko piva.

text: I’m angry that you come so late.
translate: Jezi me, da tako pozno prihajaš.

text: I think he needs a doctor.
I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.

text: We hope that he has a lot of money.
We hope that he is a millionaire.

text: I heard that she is in the hospital.
translate: Slišal(a) sem, da leži v bolnišnici.

text: I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
translate: Slišal(a) sem, da je tvoj avto popolnoma uničen.

text: I’m happy that you are interested.
translate: Veseli me, da vas zanima (da ste zainteresirani).

text: I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
translate: Veseli me, da hočete kupiti hišo.

text: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
translate: Bojim se, da se je zadnji avtobus že odpeljal.

text: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
translate: Bojim se, da moramo (morava) vzeti taksi.

text: I’m afraid I have no more money.
translate: Bojim se, da nimam denarja pri sebi.

text: I don’t know if he loves me.
translate: Ne vem, ali me ljubi (ima rad).

text: I don’t know if he’ll come back.
translate: Ne vem, ali se bo vrnil.

text: I don’t know if he’ll call me.
translate: Ne vem, ali me bo poklical.

text: I wonder if he thinks about me.
I wonder if he has someone else.
translate: Sprašujem se, ali ima kakšno drugo.

text: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
translate: Dvomim, da me ima zares rad.

text: I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
I doubt whether he’ll marry me.
translate: Dvomim, da se bo poročil z mano.
Ali se bo sploh poročil z mano?

text: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
translate: Počakam, dokler se mi ne posušijo lasje.

text: I’ll wait until the film is over.
translate: Počakam, dokler se film ne konča.

text: I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
translate: Počakam, dokler semafor ne bo zelen.

text: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
translate: Ja, še preden se začnejo poletne počitnice.

text: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
translate: Popravi streho, preden se začne zima.

text: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
translate: Umij si roke, preden sedeš za mizo.

text: Close the window before you go out.
Yes, after the class is over.
translate: Ja, potem ko bo konec pouka.

text: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
translate: Potem, ko se mu je zgodila nesreča, ni več mogel delati.

text: My son did not want to play with the doll.
translate: Moj sin se ni hotel igrati s punčko.

text: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
translate: Moja hči ni hotela igrati nogometa.

text: My wife did not want to play chess with me.
translate: Moja žena ni hotela igrati z menoj šaha.

text: My children did not want to go for a walk.
translate: Moji otroci niso hoteli iti na sprehod.

text: They did not want to tidy the room.
After he had lost his job, he went to America.
translate: Potem, ko je izgubil delo, je odšel v Ameriko.

text: After he went to America, he became rich.
translate: Potem, ko je šel v Ameriko, je postal bogat.

text: They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
translate: On ni smel jesti nobenih sladoledov.

text: He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
translate: On ni smel jesti nobene čokolade.

text: He was not allowed to eat sweets.
translate: On ni smel jesti nobenih bonbonov.

text: I was allowed to make a wish.
I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
I was allowed to take a chocolate.
Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
translate: Ali si smel(a) kaditi na letalu?

text: Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
translate: Ali si smel(a) piti pivo v bolnišnici?

text: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
translate: Ali si smel(a) imeti v hotelu s sabo psa?

text: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
translate: Med počitnicami so otroci smeli dlje časa ostajati zunaj.

text: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
translate: Smeli so se dlje časa igrati na dvorišču.

text: They were allowed to stay up late.
translate: Smeli so dlje časa ostajati pokonci.

text: Since when is she no longer working?
translate: Od kdaj ona več ne dela?

text: Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
translate: Ja, ona ne dela več, odkar se je poročila.

text: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
translate: Odkar se je poročila, ne dela več.

text: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
translate: Odkar imata otroke, gresta poredkoma ven.

text: She watches TV while she irons.
She listens to music while she does her work.
translate: Posluša glasbo, medtem ko opravlja svoje naloge.

text: I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
translate: Nič ne vidim, kadar nimam očal.

text: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
translate: Nič ne razumem, kadar je glasba tako glasna.

text: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
translate: Nič ne voham, kadar imam nahod.

text: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
translate: Vzeli bomo taksi, če bo deževalo.

text: We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
translate: Šli bomo na potovanje po svetu, če zadenemo na lotu.

text: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
translate: Začeli bomo jesti, če ne bo kmalu prišel.

text: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
translate: Potovanje je bilo sicer lepo, ampak preveč utrudljivo.

text: The train was on time, but too full.
translate: Vlak je bil sicer točen, vendar pa prepoln.

text: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
translate: Hotel je bil sicer udoben, vendar pa predrag.

text: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
translate: On bo šel bodisi z avtobusom, bodisi z vlakom.

text: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
translate: On bo prišel bodisi nocoj, ali pa zjutraj.

text: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
translate: Stanoval bo bodisi pri nas, ali pa v hotelu.

text: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
translate: Ona govori tako špansko, kot tudi angleško.

text: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
translate: Ona je živela tako v Madridu, kot tudi v Londonu.

text: She knows Spain as well as England.
translate: Ona pozna tako Španijo, kot tudi Anglijo.

text: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
translate: On ni le neumen, pač pa je tudi len.

text: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
translate: Ona ni samo lepa, pač pa je tudi pametna.

text: She speaks not only German, but also French.
translate: Ona ne govori samo nemško, pač pa tudi francosko.

text: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
translate: Ne znam igrati niti na klavir, niti na kitaro.

text: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
translate: Ne znam plesati niti valčka, niti sambe.

text: I like neither opera nor ballet.
translate: Nimam rad niti opere, niti baleta.

text: The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
translate: Hitreje ko boš delal, prej boš končal.

text: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
translate: Prej ko boš prišel, prej boš lahko šel.

text: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
translate: Starejši ko si, udobneje ti je.
Kakšno kravato si imel(a) na sebi?

text: Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
He fell asleep although the TV was on.
translate: Zaspal je, čeprav je bil televizor vklopljen.

text: He stayed a while although it was late.
translate: Še je ostal, čeprav je bilo že pozno.

text: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
translate: Ni prišel, čeprav smo se dogovorili.

text: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
translate: Televizor je bil prižgan. Kljub temu je zaspal.

text: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
translate: Bilo je že pozno. Kljub temu je še ostal.

text: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
translate: Dogovorili smo se. Kljub temu ni prišel.

text: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
translate: Čeprav nima vozniškega dovoljenja, vozi avto.

text: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
translate: Čeprav je cesta spolzka, vozi hitro.

text: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
translate: Čeprav je pijan, se pelje s kolesom.

text: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
translate: On nima vozniškega dovoljenja. Kljub temu vozi avto.

text: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
translate: Cesta je spolzka. Kljub temu vozi tako hitro.

text: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
translate: On je pijan. Kljub temu se pelje s kolesom.

text: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
translate: Nobene službe ne najde, čeprav je študirala.

text: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ona ne gre k zdravniku, čeprav čuti bolečine.

text: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
translate: Ona kupuje avto, čeprav nima denarja.

text: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
translate: Študirala je. Kljub temu ne najde nobene službe.

text: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
translate: Ona čuti bolečine. Kljub temu ne gre k zdravniku.

text: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
translate: Ona nima denarja. Kljub temu kupuje avto.

text: Have you already been to Berlin?
translate: Ali ste že bili kdaj v Berlinu?

text: No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
translate: Ne, ne ostanem več dolgo tu.

text: Would you like to drink something else?
No, I don’t want anything else.
No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
Does anyone else want a coffee?
I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
translate: Postanem utrujen, brž ko se moram začeti učiti.

text: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
translate: Prenehal bom delati, brž ko dopolnim 60 let.

text: As soon as I have a moment.
translate: Takoj ko bom imel trenutek prostega časa.

text: He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
translate: Pokliče, takoj ko bo imel nekaj prostega časa.

text: I’ll work as long as I can.
I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
He lies in bed instead of working.
translate: On leži v postelji, namesto da bi delal.

text: She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
translate: On bere časopis, namesto da bi kuhal.

text: He is at the bar instead of going home.
translate: On sedi v gostilni, namesto da bi šel domov.

text: As far as I know, he lives here.
As far as I know, his wife is ill.
translate: Kolikor vem, je njegova žena bolna.

text: As far as I know, he is unemployed.
I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Zaspal(a) sem, drugače bi bil točen (bila točna).

text: The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
translate: Kako pridem do hiše njihovih staršev?

text: The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
translate: Kako se imenuje glavno mesto Švice?

text: What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
translate: Ob katerih urah je odprt muzej?

text: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Zamudil(a) sem avtobus, drugače bi bil točen (bila točna).

text: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
translate: Nisem našel (našla) poti, drugače bi bil točen (bila točna).

text: We are cleaning the apartment today.
My husband is washing the car.
The children are cleaning the bicycles.
translate: Otroci čistijo kolesa. / Otroka čistita kolesi (kolesa).

text: The children are cleaning up the children’s room.
My husband is tidying up his desk.
I am putting the laundry in the washing machine.
translate: Jaz vlagam perilo v pralni stroj.

text: I am hanging up the laundry.

translate: Ali bi se dalo to popraviti?

text: There is no telephone in the room.
There is no TV in the room.
Is there a youth hostel nearby?
translate: Je tu v bližini kakšen hostel?

text: Is there a boarding house / a bed and breakfast nearby?
translate: Je tu v bližini kakšen penzion?
Je tu v bližini kakšna restavracija?
